results.title: Time for thought
results.creator_credit: Patrick Pullen, John O'Neill, Film Producers Guild and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer farming”
The film is designed to counteract the high incidence of farm accidents - which commonly occur in connection with tractors. Three accidents to farm workers which were caused by careless use of tractors and other farm equipment are shown.

results.title: Means of being rescued
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the importance of storing safety equipment on small craft, of being prepared for an emergency, and the correct distress procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, Patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer. Credits: Producer, Peter Johnson; director, script, Rob McAuley; photographer, Peter Hopwood; editor, Max Lemon; sound, Harry Haws; commentator, Ken Warby.

Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.

results.title: Techniques of the skilled driver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
An instructor in a driver-training course uses the experiences of a former student in explaining that proper practice and a correct attitude are essential in the development of a skilled driver.

group_siblings.title: The Defensive driver
group_siblings.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films

results.title: The Defensive driver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A father who accompanies his son on a short drive observes that his son is a safe driver who anticipates dangerous situations and drives defensively in order to avoid accidents. Father and son discuss driving hazards which require alertness and courtesy, as well as skill, on the part of drivers: overcrowded areas, complicated traffic lights, pedestrians, emergency vehicles, road signs, grade crossings, and student drivers.

results.title: Car maintenance and care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A garage mechanic explains that a car remains attractive, economical, dependable, and safe to drive if the owner keeps the car in good condition. Discusses preventative measures to be followed: regular checking and servicing, listening for unusual sounds indicating engine trouble, checking instrument panel for warnings of trouble, rotating the tyres periodically, and driving carefully to safeguard brakes, tyres, transmission and springs.
